ContentMutiple.name: White House To Put Forth Crypto Executive Order This Week
ContentMutiple.description: An executive order focused on the digital asset industry is expected to be signed by President Biden this week, according to reports.
ContentMutiple.content:
An executive order focused on the digital asset industry is expected to be signed by President Biden this week, according to reports.

The order will direct various government agencies to study cryptocurrencies, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), and come up with a government-wide plan on regulating digital assets.

Sources familiar with the matter told Yahoo News that the directive will request a study of CBDCs involving multiple agencies, including the Department of Treasury, State Department, Department of Justice, and Homeland Security. Together, the government bodies will report on the future of money and payment systems while the Director of the Office of Science and Tech policy will perform a technical evaluation of what could be necessary to support a CBDC system.

According to Bloomberg, the rollout of President Biden’s expected executive order was slowed down by a rift between the White House and the Treasury. Bloomberg’s sources said that Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen felt that an executive order was unnecessary, particularly one that mentioned a CBDC.

The Treasury chief reportedly also said that since the Federal Reserve is still researching CBDCs, more time should be allowed to let the agency develop its stance. Yellen’s team reportedly told the White House that the Treasury, along with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), had made progress on creating more clarity on US regulation regarding digital currencies.

Rumors of the conflict between the White House and Treasury were discounted by spokesman John Rizzo who said the account “is inaccurate,” but didn’t clarify Yellen’s role in the executive order.

“Treasury continues to work closely with our partners throughout the administration and in the White House,” he said.

News of the expected executive order come following a series of new moves by the Biden administration to address the rise of digital currencies.

Last week, Feds launched a new digital currency enforcement unit. The US Justice Department named Eun Young Choi to serve as the first Director of the National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team (NCET).

The NET aims to put a focus on looking into cases of criminal use of digital assets involving virtual currency exchanges, mixing and tumbling services, infrastructure providers, and “other entities that are enabling the misuse of cryptocurrency and related technologies to commit or facilitate criminal activity.”
ContentMutiple.seo_title: White House To Put Forth Crypto Executive Order This Week
ContentMutiple.search_unicode: white house to put forth crypto executive order this week

ContentMutiple.name: Binance Copy Trading (2025): Real ROI, Risks & Smarter Picks
ContentMutiple.description: See how Binance copy trading actually performs in 2025. Real trader stats, risks, and better alternatives like Bybit & Bitget revealed.
ContentMutiple.content:
Thinking about using Binance Copy Trading in 2025 — but not sure if it’s really worth it? You're not alone. With dozens of platforms promising "easy profits," it's hard to know what's real, what works, and what’s just hype.

In this breakdown, we’ll go beyond the marketing. You’ll see:

  • Real performance stats from actual Binance lead traders

  • A head-to-head comparison with Bybit and Bitget

  • Key risks most beginners overlook

  • And smarter ways to copy trade in 2025 — based on real data

Let’s find out if Binance is the best fit for you — or if smarter alternatives offer more control and better ROI.

📈 Quick Comparison – Binance vs Bybit vs Bitget

Feature Binance Bybit Bitget
Copy Fee Up to 30% 10–15% Fixed or % (max 20%)
Risk Metrics ❌ None ✅ Basic Drawdown ✅ Filters + Drawdown
Backtesting ❌ No ✅ Limited ✅ Yes
Social Insight ❌ Minimal ✅ Comments, Stats ✅ Rich trader data
Best For Beginners, passive seekers Balanced control + ROI Advanced filters, copy diversification

What Is Binance Copy Trading & How It Works

Binance Copy Trading allows users to automatically mirror trades from experienced lead traders. It’s a passive way to engage in futures trading without making manual decisions.

How it works:

  1. Browse the Binance Futures Copy Trading Leaderboard

  2. Choose a trader based on ROI, AUM, and followers

  3. Set your budget (minimum $10)

  4. The system auto-replicates their trades into your account

📌 No prior trading experience required. But convenience comes at the cost of transparency and control.

🖥️ What Binance’s Copy Trading Dashboard Looks Like

Before copying a trader, you’ll land on Binance’s Futures Leaderboard – a sortable table of top-performing lead traders.

You’ll see stats like:

  • ✅ 30-day ROI & total PnL

  • 📈 Number of followers

  • 💰 AUM (Assets Under Management)

  • 🔍 Risk level (basic, but still limited)

Once you choose a trader, you’ll enter the Copy settings panel where you can:

  • Set fixed amount or percentage per trade

  • Enable “Stop Copy” option anytime

  • Track open positions in real-time

 

🧠 Tip: Avoid copying any trader with >30% ROI but no long-term stats. The dashboard doesn’t show drawdown — so check consistency manually.

🌟 Start Copy Trading on Binance and unlock your $100 USDT bonus with code Z7NCPK27
